content:
Diagnosis:	High grade mixed serous and clear cell ovarian carcinoma, Stage IIIC, BRCA2 mutation positive (somatic)

Initial presentation March 2023 with extensive peritoneal disease and right pleural effusion. Debulking surgery not feasible due to disease extent.

Received 6 cycles carboplatin/paclitaxel March-August 2023 with partial response. Commenced maintenance olaparib 300mg BD August 2023.

Unfortunately, recent CT shows disease progression with increasing peritoneal deposits, new ascites, and enlarging right pleural effusion. CA125 has risen from 45 to 890 over 8 weeks. Performance status has declined from 1 to 2.

I reviewed [redacted name] today with her daughter. She reports increasing abdominal distension and early satiety. She has also developed increasing breathlessness on minimal exertion. She requires additional pillows at night and can only walk short distances. Her appetite has significantly decreased with 6kg weight loss over 2 months.

On examination, she has obvious ascites with shifting dullness and decreased breath sounds at the right base. Oxygen saturations 94% on room air. Performance status is now ECOG 2.

I have discussed with [redacted name] that her disease is unfortunately progressing despite olaparib maintenance therapy. We have agreed to discontinue olaparib and commence second-line chemotherapy with carboplatin and pegylated liposomal doxorubicin (PLD). I have explained the common side effects including fatigue, mucositis, and palmar-plantar syndrome.

Plan:
- Discontinue olaparib today
- Arrange pleural aspiration next week
- Start carboplatin AUC 5 and PLD 40mg/m2 in 2 weeks pending pleural drainage
- Referral to palliative care for symptom management
- Review in 3 weeks with pre-chemotherapy bloods

primary_cancer.metastases: extensive peritoneal disease, right pleural effusion
primary_cancer.histopathology_status: High grade mixed serous and clear cell carcinoma

cancer_timeline.value: Presentation with extensive peritoneal disease and right pleural effusion
Completed 6 cycles carboplatin/paclitaxel with partial response
CA125 risen from 45 to 890 over 8 weeks
CT shows disease progression with increasing peritoneal deposits, new ascites, and enlarging right pleural effusion
Discontinuing olaparib due to disease progression

patient_facts.value: Increasing abdominal distension and early satiety
Breathlessness on minimal exertion requiring additional pillows at night
Obvious ascites with shifting dullness and decreased breath sounds at right base
Can only walk short distances, 6kg weight loss over 2 months

status_updates.value: Stage IIIC ovarian cancer progressing on olaparib maintenance with deteriorating symptoms and performance status
Disease progression on olaparib with rising CA125 and increasing peritoneal and pleural disease
Discontinuing olaparib and planning to start second-line carboplatin and PLD
Performance status declined from 1 to 2 with increasing breathlessness and reduced mobility
Review in 3 weeks with pre-chemotherapy bloods, referral to palliative care for symptom management
